text.0: thou agni shining in thy glory through the days art brought to life from out the waters from the stone.
text.1: from out the forest trees and herbs that grow on ground thou sovran lord of men art generated pure.
text.2: thine is the heralds task and cleansers duly timed leader art thou and kindler for the pious man.
text.3: thou art director thou the ministering priest thou art the brahman lord and master in our home.
text.4: hero of heroes agni thou art indra thou art viṣṇu of the mighty stride adorable.
text.5: thou brahmaṇaspati the brahman finding wealth thou o sustainer with thy wisdom tendest us.
text.6: agni thou art king varuṇa whose laws stand fast as mitra wonderworker thou must be implored.
text.7: aryaman heroes lord art thou enriching all and liberal aṁśa in the synod o thou god.
text.8: thou givest strength as tvaṣṭar to the worshipper thou wielding mitras power hast kinship with the dames.
text.9: thou urging thy fleet coursers givest noble steeds a host of heroes art thou with great store of wealth.
text.10: rudra art thou the asura of mighty heaven thou art the maruts host thou art the lord of food.
text.11: thou goest with red winds bliss hast thou in thine home as pūṣan thou thyself protectest worshippers.
text.12: giver of wealth art thou to him who honours thee thou art god savitar granter of precious things.
text.13: as bhaga lord of men thou rulest over wealth and guardest in his house him who hath served thee well.
text.14: to thee the peoples lord within the house the folk press forward to their king most graciously inclined.
text.15: lord of the lovely look all things belong to thee ten hundred yea a thousand are outweighed by thee.
text.16: agni men seek thee as a father with their prayers win thee brightformed to brotherhood with holy act.
text.17: thou art a son to him who duly worships thee and as a trusty friend thou guardest from attack.
text.18: a Ṛbhu art thou agni near to be adored thou art the sovran lord of foodful spoil and wealth.
text.19: thou shinest brightly forth thou burnest to bestow pervading sacrifice thou lendest us thine help.
text.20: thou god art aditi to him who offers gifts thou hotrā bhāratī art strengthened by the song.
text.21: thou art the hundredwintered iḷā to give strength lord of wealth vṛtraslayer and sarasvatī.
text.22: thou agni cherished well art highest vital power in thy delightful hue are glories visible.
text.23: thou art the lofty might that furthers each design thou art wealth manifold diffused on every side.
text.24: thee agni have the Ādityas taken as their mouth the bright ones have made thee o sage to be their tongue.
text.25: they who love offerings cling to thee at solemn rites by thee the gods devour the duly offered food.
text.26: by thee o agni all the immortal guileless gods cat with thy mouth the oblation that is offered them.
text.27: by thee do mortal men give sweetness to their drink bright art thou born the embryo of the plants of earth.
text.28: with these thou art united agni yea thou god of noble birth surpassest them in majesty.
text.29: which through the power of good here spreads abroad from thee diffused through both the worlds throughout the earth and heaven.
text.30: the princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise o agni guerdon graced with kine and steeds.
text.31: lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss with brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.
